channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Can the World’s Top Court Do About Climate Change?
item.description: The International Court of Justice, the United Nations’ highest judicial body, is beginning landmark hearings on global warming. Here’s a guide.

item.title: Russia’s Economy Is Slowing, Opening Fissures Over Policy
item.description: The slowdown is worrying for the Kremlin but not serious enough to significantly hobble its war effort.

item.title: These are the countries where workers are most likely to use generative AI—and the U.S. is lagging behind the leaders
item.description: Middle-income countries like India, China, and Indonesia are posting the fastest rates of AI adoption.

item.title: The Secret Pentagon War Game That ​Offers a Stark​ Warning for Our Times
item.description: The devastating outcome of the 1983 game reveals that nuclear escalation inevitably spirals out of control.

item.title: The Future 50: The companies most likely to adapt, thrive, and grow
item.description: The AI boom and a strong venture-capital culture have made the U.S. the center of activity in the 2024 edition of our list.

item.title: Wars and rising tensions spark global demand for arms, as sales hit record $632 million
